result.execSummary:
The defendant Thomas M Mueller II was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: to any other case

miscConds.notes:
BAIL APPLIED OF $250.00. Balance to be paid as a Condition of Probation.
If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
DNA surcharge WAIVED.

Maintain full time employment and/or combination of School.
Get GED.

Follow through with any other treatment/counseling recommended by Agent.
No contact with: co-defendant, John Fears or any Home Depot Store.
DNA Sample WAIVED. (and surcharge)
Attend Criminal Thinking class

records.addlTxt: Sentencing hearing on June 29, 2015 at 09:00 am.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Thomas M Mueller in court with attorney Jorge R Fragoso.  Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Amended Information filed. Reading waived.   Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 2.  Court finds defendant guilty. Defense requests a separate date for sentencing. Court grants request. Bail remains as fixed.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 29, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 16, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Attorney Jorge R Fragoso in court.   Defendant Thomas M Mueller did not appear.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense advises his client is ill and requests another date. Restitution addressed. Defense requests another date next week.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 16, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 12, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Thomas M Mueller in court with attorney Jorge R Fragoso.  Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense addresses restitution. Defendant has paid half the restitution and needs to pay the other half. Court will schedule for plea/sentencing in early June.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 12, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 24, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Thomas M Mueller in court with attorney Jorge R Fragoso.  Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense requests another date. Defendant needs to pay back the balance of restitution.   State has offer to amend charge. Court grants request.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 24, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on March 13, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Thomas M Mueller in court with attorney Jorge R. Fragoso.  Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense advises this will not go to plea/sentencing. Defendant needs to pay upfront restitution and requests another date in 60 days for plea/sentencing. Court grants request.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 13, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on January 7, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Attorney Jorge R. Fragoso in court.   Defendant Thomas M Mueller did not appear.   Barbara A. Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense explains the defendant's absence and is requesting an early January date. Court grants request.   Court ordered a capias stayed until next court date. Case recalled. Defendant now appears. Defense explains why the defendant was late. Court will continued this matter to January 7, 2015 at 10:00 am. Court orders the capias quashed (not issued).
Hearing on December 17, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Thomas M Mueller in court with attorney Jorge R. Fragoso.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense requests a new date in mid-December.  Court grants the request.  Defendant provides current address to the Court.  Hearing scheduled for December 17, 2014 at 09:00 am.
